title: Procrastination and Stress: Exploring the Role of Self-Compassion
summary: Procrastination is linked to high stress and low self-compassion. The 'shame spiral' (feeling bad about procrastinating) drains the emotional resources needed to restart. Self-compassion breaks this loop.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Significant reduction in stress and anxiety, which are key drivers of avoidance behaviors.

mechanisms.name: Emotion Regulation
mechanisms.description: Reducing the negative affect (guilt/shame) associated with task failure.

mechanisms.name: Growth Mindset
mechanisms.description: Framing failure as a data point for learning rather than a character flaw.

mechanisms.name: Resource Restoration
mechanisms.description: By not wasting energy on self-criticism, the user has more cognitive resources available to try again.

actionable_strategies.name: Non-Judgmental Reflection
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: After a drift, ask 'What happened?' or 'How was the focus?' instead of 'Why did you fail?' or 'You missed your goal.'

actionable_strategies.name: Fresh Start Framing
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: If a streak is broken, allow a 'repair' action or simply start a new day without a heavy penalty screen.
